title: Case Study: Mapping the developing human immune system across organs
text: types files project ? Retrieve cache locally files needed construct gene x cell count matrix.
code: files1 <- files(project_filter)  files1 |>     glimpse() ## Rows: 603 ## Columns: 8 ## $ fileId       <chr> "4f5ffb59-61ca-47e5-b68a-188112452aa2", "9564d626-b087-47… ## $ name         <chr> "FCAImmP7803027_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz", "Human_colon_16… ## $ fileFormat   <chr> "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "tiff", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "… ## $ size         <dbl> 11850709225, 1175980920, 210360452, 8144936781, 113257245… ## $ version      <chr> "2022-07-18T22:19:16.681000Z", "2022-07-18T22:19:33.75400… ## $ projectTitle <chr> "Mapping the developing human immune system across organs… ## $ projectId    <chr> "fcaa53cd-ba57-4bfe-af9c-eaa958f95c1a", "fcaa53cd-ba57-4b… ## $ url          <chr> "https://service.azul.data.humancellatlas.org/repository/…  files1 |>     dplyr::count(fileFormat) ## # A tibble: 4 × 2 ##   fileFormat     n ##   <chr>      <int> ## 1 csv            1 ## 2 fastq.gz     579 ## 3 h5ad           8 ## 4 tiff          15  ## create `files2` with just the files needed for count-matrix ## analysis  files2 <-     files1 |>     filter(fileFormat == "h5ad") file_path <-     files2 |>     files_download() |>     setNames(files2 |> pull(name))  ## join file path to appropriate components of `f` count_matrix_files1 <-     files2 |>     left_join(tibble(         fileId = files2$fileId,         local.filePath = unname(file_path)     ), by = "fileId")

code: h5ad_file_paths <-     count_matrix_files1 |>     pull(local.filePath) h5ad <- read_h5ad(h5ad_file_paths[1]) SingleCellExperiment(     assays = list(X = Matrix::t(h5ad$X)),     colData = h5ad$obs, rowData = h5ad$var,     metadata = h5ad$uns,     reducedDims = h5ad$obsm )

what: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
title: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
text: cache() creates / returns 'BiocFileCache' object containing information objects package-specific cache. cache_exists() tests whether object exists cache. object identified concatentation project_id object_name argument. cache_list() summarizes project objects available cache. cache_add() adds object cache, using project_id object_name create identifier. writer_function used save object cache. cache_read() retrieves object cache, using project_id object_name create identifier. reader_function used read object R. cache_remove() removes object cache.

title: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
code: cache(create = TRUE)  cache_exists(project_id, object_name)  cache_list()  cache_add(   object,   project_id,   object_name,   writer_function = saveRDS,   ...,   overwrite = FALSE )  cache_read(project_id, object_name, reader_function = readRDS, ...)  cache_remove(project_id, object_name)

title: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
text: create logical(1) create cache exist? Default: TRUE. project_id character(1) project identifier, e.g., "3c9d586e-bd26-4b46-8690-3faaa18ccf38". object_name character(1) arbitrary object identifier. Cached objects created Case Study vignettes prefixed "local.", e.g., "local.countMatrix". object R object. writer_function function taking first argument object, second argument cache file path (determined internally) store object, additional arguments (... cache_add()) required write object. ... cache_read(), ... arguments passed 'reader_function()`. overwrite logical(1) overwrite existing object cache? default FALSE, attempts write object result error. reader_function function taking first argument cache file path (determined internally) object, additional arguments (... cache_add()) required write object.

title: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
text: cache() returns BiocFileCache object can manipulated using interface defined BiocFileCache package. cache_exists() returns logical(1) value, TRUE object identified projectId object_name exists cache. cache_list() returns tibble two columns: project_id object_name objects cache. can use , e.g., cache_read() cache_remove(). cache_add() returns, invisibly, cache file path object stored. cache_read() returns value returned reader_function(). cache_remove() warns object cache, returns FALSE invisibly, removes object returns TRUE invisibly.

title: Cache of Computationally Expensive Objects for Reuse — cache
code: cache() #> class: BiocFileCache #> bfccache: /Users/ma38727/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/HCACaseStudies #> bfccount: 11 #> For more information see: bfcinfo() or bfcquery()  faux_project_id <- "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" faux_object_name <- "local.fauxObject"  cache_exists(faux_project_id, faux_object_name) #> [1] FALSE  cache_list() #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    project_id                           object_name             #>    <chr>                                <chr>                   #>  1 5b910a43-7fb5-4ea7-b9d6-43dbd1bf2776 local.countMatrix       #>  2 3c9d586e-bd26-4b46-8690-3faaa18ccf38 local.countMatrix       #>  3 9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660 local.countMatrix       #>  4 8f630e0f-6bf9-4a04-9754-02533152a954 local.countMatrix       #>  5 9a23ac2d-93dd-4bac-9bb8-040e6426db9d local.countMatrix       #>  6 66d7d92a-d6c5-492c-815b-f81c7c93c984 local.countMatrix       #>  7 74e2ef9d-7c9f-418c-b281-7fb38f3b1571 local.countMatrix       #>  8 8b9cb6ae-6a43-4e47-b9fb-3df7aeec941f local.countMatrix       #>  9 a7c66eb1-4a4e-4f6c-9e30-ad2a485f8301 local.countMatrix       #> 10 4c73d1e4-bad2-4a22-a0ba-55abbdbdcc3d local.human.countMatrix  cache_exists(faux_project_id, faux_object_name)       # FALSE #> [1] FALSE cache_add(letters, faux_project_id, faux_object_name) cache_exists(faux_project_id, faux_object_name)       # TRUE #> [1] TRUE  cache_read(faux_project_id, faux_object_name) #>  [1] "a" "b" "c" "d" "e" "f" "g" "h" "i" "j" "k" "l" "m" "n" "o" "p" "q" "r" "s" #> [20] "t" "u" "v" "w" "x" "y" "z"  cache_remove(faux_project_id, faux_object_name) cache_exists(faux_project_id, faux_object_name)       # FALSE #> [1] FALSE

title: Tests on Column Content — column_is_not_all_NA
text: column_is_not_all_NA() tests whether elements column x NA (undefined). column_is_informative() returns TRUE column x contains values differ across rows, hence informative status row. column_is_experimentwide() returns TRUE column x NA, values column unique.

title: Tests on Column Content — column_is_not_all_NA
code: column_is_not_all_NA(x)  column_is_informative(x)  column_is_experimentwide(x)

title: Tests on Column Content — column_is_not_all_NA
text: x R vector .na() defined.

title: Tests on Column Content — column_is_not_all_NA
text: column_is_not_all_NA() returns TRUE elements x NA, FALSE otherwise.

title: Tests on Column Content — column_is_not_all_NA
code: example_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(     x = letters,     y = c(NA, tail(letters, -1)),     z = rep(NA, length(letters)),     w = "A" ) example_tbl |>     dplyr::select(where(column_is_not_all_NA))     # x, y, w #> # A tibble: 26 × 3 #>    x     y     w     #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 a     NA    A     #>  2 b     b     A     #>  3 c     c     A     #>  4 d     d     A     #>  5 e     e     A     #>  6 f     f     A     #>  7 g     g     A     #>  8 h     h     A     #>  9 i     i     A     #> 10 j     j     A     #> # … with 16 more rows  example_tbl |>     dplyr::select(where(column_is_informative))    # x, y #> # A tibble: 26 × 2 #>    x     y     #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 a     NA    #>  2 b     b     #>  3 c     c     #>  4 d     d     #>  5 e     e     #>  6 f     f     #>  7 g     g     #>  8 h     h     #>  9 i     i     #> 10 j     j     #> # … with 16 more rows  example_tbl |>     dplyr::select(where(column_is_experimentwide)) # w #> # A tibble: 26 × 1 #>    w     #>    <chr> #>  1 A     #>  2 A     #>  3 A     #>  4 A     #>  5 A     #>  6 A     #>  7 A     #>  8 A     #>  9 A     #> 10 A     #> # … with 16 more rows

what: Summarize Tab- or Comma-Separated Files — csv_tsv_count_lines
title: Summarize Tab- or Comma-Separated Files — csv_tsv_count_lines
text: csv_tsv_count_lines() counts number lines one several comma- tab-delimited files.

title: Summarize Tab- or Comma-Separated Files — csv_tsv_count_lines
code: csv_tsv_count_lines(.data, file_id = "fileId", file_path = "local.filePath")

title: Summarize Tab- or Comma-Separated Files — csv_tsv_count_lines
text: .data tibble containing column file_id file_path columns. file_id character(1) column name .data containing (unique) identifier files line counts requested. file_path character(1) column name .data containing file paths file lines counted.

title: Summarize Tab- or Comma-Separated Files — csv_tsv_count_lines
text: csv_tsv_count_lines() returns original tibble .data additional column local.lines containing number lines file_path.

title: Summarize GEO Files — cell_count_csv
text: cell_count_csv() parses GEO GSM csv file number cells present file. cell_count_tsv() parses GEO GSM tsv file number cells present file. gene_count() parses GEO GSM file number genes present file. count_matrix_csv() returns sparse matrix gene x cell counts csv file(s). count_matrix_tsv() returns sparse matrix gene x cell counts tsv file(s).

title: Summarize GEO Files — cell_count_csv
code: cell_count_csv(.data)  cell_count_tsv(.data)  gene_count(.data)  count_matrix_csv(.data)  count_matrix_tsv(.data)

title: Summarize GEO Files — cell_count_csv
text: .data files_tbl_hca object (e.g., created hca::files()) containing fileId local.filePath columns. rows .data must refer GSM files.

title: Summarize GEO Files — cell_count_csv
text: cell_count_*() returns .data augmented column local.cellCount reporting number cells file. gene_count() returns .data augmented column gene counts, "local.geneCount". count_matrix_*() returns sparse matrix rows (genes) equal unique genes input files, columns (cells) equal total cell count GSM files. Samples order present .data.

title: Summarize GEO Files — cell_count_csv
text: cell_count_*() parses first line GSM file, assuming line 'header' gene first column cell labels subsequent columns. number cells number columns file minus 1. gene_count() counts number lines file, reports number genes number minus one, assuming first line 'header' line. count_matrix_*() parses GEO GSM file turn, assuming file contains dense matrix. dense matrix converted sparse representation. file processed, new genes appended original index, cells appended j index. final result concatenation sparse matrix representations. Progress reports amount memory currently consumed cummulating object.

title: Summarize 'MatrixMart' files — mtx_count_matrix
text: mtx_count_matrix() parses one several MatrixMart files identical dimensions single dgCMatrix object.

title: Summarize 'MatrixMart' files — mtx_count_matrix
code: mtx_count_matrix(   .data,   mtx_path,   genes_path = NULL,   barcodes_path = NULL,   sep = "\t" )

title: Summarize 'MatrixMart' files — mtx_count_matrix
text: .data tibble containing column value mtx_path parameter , non-NULL, columns value parameters genes_path barcodes_path. mtx_path character() paths MatrixMart files disk. genes_path character() (optional) paths files containing gene (row) labels (e.g., ENSEMBL gene identifiers). row labels must first column file; fields separated parameter sep; can column headers file. barcodes_path character() (optional) paths files containing cell (column) labels (e.g., barcodes). column labels must first column file; fields separated parameter sep; can column headers file. sep character(1), default "\t" (tab). Field separator genes_path barcodes_path files.

title: Summarize 'MatrixMart' files — mtx_count_matrix
text: mtx_count_matrix() returns dgCMatrix sparse matrix rows (genes) equal unique genes input files, columns (cells) equal total cell count MatrixMart files. Samples (columns) order present .data.

what: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
text: use_template() creates new R markdown file starting point case study. file requires manual editing customize specific project.

title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
code: use_template(project_id, case_study_path, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
text: project_id character(1) project identifier, e.g., "3c9d586e-bd26-4b46-8690-3faaa18ccf38". case_study_path character(1) path directory case study created. overwrite logical(1) overwrite case study created function project_id case_study_path? Default: FALSE.

title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
text: use_template() returns path rendered template (case_study_path) approriate substitution variables.

title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
text: use_template() queries HCA data portal project title associated project_id, uses title vignette index entry rendered markdown doeucment. project_id injected document, references project_id defined. Rendering template also injects current date, package name, package version.

title: Templates For New Case Studies — use_template
code: project_id <- "3c9d586e-bd26-4b46-8690-3faaa18ccf38" case_study_path <- tempfile(); dir.create(case_study_path) rmd <- use_template(project_id, case_study_path) readLines(rmd) |>     head() |>     noquote() #> [1] ---                                                                                                                #> [2] title: "Case Study: Highly Parallel Genome-wide Expression Profiling of Individual Cells Using Nanoliter Droplets" #> [3] author:                                                                                                            #> [4]   - name: Martin Morgan                                                                                            #> [5]     affiliation:                                                                                                   #> [6]     - Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center
